translation: to take care of, to handle, to manage, to treat (medically) / I take care of the child at home.
to take care of, to handle, to manage, to treat (medically) / You take care of the garden in the summer.
to take care of, to handle, to manage, to treat (medically) / He/She takes care of the sick dog.
to take care of, to handle, to manage, to treat (medically) / We handle errands in the city.
to take care of, to handle, to manage, to treat (medically) / You (plural) take care of the house together.
to take care of, to handle, to manage, to treat (medically) / They take care of their parents with love.
